reviews.review: notch this is stupid there is no copper golems or shelf’s and no copper chains/lanterns/torch /copper bars/nautilus not all of that I’ll give you 1 stars
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a copper-themed expansion pack including copper golems, shelves, chains, lanterns, torches, bars, and nautilus shells to enhance building and decoration options in the Minecraft-inspired app.

reviews.review: Minecraft mineCRAP
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a lightweight, optimized mobile version of Minecraft with simplified graphics and controls to appeal to users frustrated with the current app's performance and quality.

reviews.review: I was playing a server than bam it kicked me out and restarted all my progress and also add in’s in this game tried to flirt with me and I’m a minor
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce enhanced child safety features in multiplayer games, including automatic age verification, flirtation detection in chats, and instant blocking/reporting for inappropriate interactions with minors.

reviews.review: Why was France dropping when I literally destroyed its government removed almost all lethality and destroyed the entire European continent I don’t understand why  it was not spreading what kind of game is this
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce an in-game mechanics explainer feature that provides real-time tooltips and post-action summaries to clarify why certain strategies, like government destruction, impact disease spread or country stability in unexpected ways.

reviews.review: Tried the shadow and at one point features just stopped working.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an auto-recovery mechanism for features that fail during use, allowing seamless resumption without loss of progress.

reviews.review: Well, all my speed runs are still have a good score, they are no longer at global scoreboard.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an automated leaderboard refresh mechanism to ensure high-scoring speed runs are promptly added to the global scoreboard, addressing visibility issues for competitive users.

reviews.review: if you click on the privacy policy it will list about something I don't know 50 different companies they sell your ads to. It gives you the apparent option to opt out of all of them but when you click it nothing happens. I'll be damned if you're gonna sell my info. Deleted the app.
reviews.potential_idea: Analysis failed.

reviews.review: Don’t agree with them removing levels. They should all be available to play.
reviews.potential_idea: Add a 'legacy levels' mode that unlocks all previously removed game levels for users to replay at any time.

reviews.review: Im not I'm surprised that the game was removed again. The new engine does not convey the atmosphere of the old classics. And new pigs model is terrifying
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a user toggle to switch between classic and modern graphics engines, allowing players to experience the nostalgic atmosphere of the original game while accessing new features.

reviews.review: I purchased extra packs and they never uploaded to my game. I’ve hit restore purchases and it doesn’t show. I’ve tried to buy the pack again but it says already purchased and brings me to my decks… which isn’t there… I’ve deleted the app to clear the cache- nope. I’ve tried reaching out to app developers and get a 404 page not found error. I purchased several packs in the past and then switched to Android so understandly lost those packs.  But now that I’m back to an iPhone my previously purchased and my new ones never show.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a cross-platform account system that syncs in-app purchases across iOS and Android devices, ensuring seamless restoration regardless of OS switches.

reviews.review: I love this game, but it does not work for kids. That’s learning to read. I thought it would have pictures of animals. so for me it was a waste of money.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop an educational reading app for kids featuring interactive pictures of animals to teach phonics and vocabulary, tailored for early learners.

reviews.review: Horrible app, lures many into buying it thinking they’ll be able to play instantly. Turns out you need to purchase endless pricey card decks to get any value. Feel downright cheated.
reviews.potential_idea: Create a card game app that provides a fully functional starter deck for free, enabling instant core gameplay without mandatory in-app purchases to unlock essential value.

reviews.review: What happened to the bible deck? want to play it with my church
reviews.potential_idea: Reintroduce a Bible-themed deck with enhanced multiplayer features for group play in religious communities, integrating scripture-based cards for educational and fun church gatherings.

reviews.review: While inside a Disney park, the pack labeled Disney parks is not free as listed in the app. This is false advertising and extremely frustrating. I’ve downloaded the app thrice and restarted my phone as well as location services.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a location-aware content unlocker that verifies user presence in Disney parks via GPS and automatically grants free access to the Disney parks pack without misleading listings.

reviews.review: I thought it was a one time purchase for a deck but I just got charged again a month later. I click  on the “App Support” in the Apple Store to try and resolve this/stop the payment and web link is invalid. I even checked under subscriptions and it doesn’t list it as reoccurring.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-app billing dashboard that clearly displays purchase history, distinguishes between one-time and recurring charges with detailed explanations, and provides direct, functional links to manage or cancel subscriptions without relying on external store support.

reviews.review: when we call out the answer, it doesn’t recognize the correct answer.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop an improved voice recognition feature for quiz apps that enhances accuracy for spoken answers by incorporating accent adaptation and phonetic matching.

reviews.review: Even if you purchase the app, you barely have any ‘decks’ to play with. Only very specific decks, and only a couple. Game is blocked behind a paywall — and then has way more to buy. I wish I could get a refund
reviews.potential_idea: Create a card game app offering a one-time premium purchase that unlocks a wide variety of customizable decks and full content access, eliminating additional in-app paywalls to ensure complete value from the initial buy.

reviews.review:
Bought the app, could not find how to create a custom deck; when I clicked the link for “get help” the page was “404 not found”

Unless this gets fixed, do not buy.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an interactive in-app tutorial with searchable help sections to guide users on creating custom decks, replacing broken external links.

reviews.review: While at a Walt Disney World Park, i tried to download the free Disney Parks pack. The app verified my location but wouldn’t let me download the pack. It would try to charge me the cost of the set of packs.
reviews.potential_idea: Add a pre-download eligibility confirmation feature that re-verifies location and pack status to prevent accidental charging prompts for free in-park content.

reviews.review: Hated this game, very stupid, would make your kids stupid just from playing..🥸
reviews.potential_idea: Create an AI-powered educational app for kids that gamifies learning critical thinking and problem-solving to counter mindless entertainment and boost cognitive development.

reviews.review: Why don’t they let you buy a single deck? I don’t want to spend $12.99 when I will only use 1/4 decks. So stupid. Also, bring back the Drag Race deck!
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce an à la carte purchasing option for individual decks, allowing users to buy only the ones they need without requiring bundled packs, and reintroduce fan-favorite decks like Drag Race.

reviews.review: I bought a pack of decks for $13 and it is showing up in my purchases on my iPhone, but none of the content in the pack is showing up in the my decks section.. so I can’t play them. I tried  selecting restore purchases, but that isn’t working either..
reviews.potential_idea: Develop an enhanced automatic sync feature that verifies and immediately unlocks purchased content across devices upon login or purchase confirmation, reducing reliance on manual restore options.

reviews.review: No free decks??? After paying for the app you have to spend $20+ to play at all?
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce free starter decks that allow users to play basic games immediately after purchasing the app, without requiring additional in-app purchases.

reviews.review: I like this game a lot when it works, but I’ve recently tried playing it again and it will open to the “hold to forehead” screen and then not work any further.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an auto-retry or timeout mechanism for the 'hold to forehead' sensor initiation screen to prevent users from getting stuck and improve game accessibility.

reviews.review: I’m in the paths but can’t get Disney parks to download for Jess than $9.99 even though it’s supposed to be free
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an automatic free content entitlement checker in the app to detect and apply promotional pricing, preventing users from being charged for supposed free downloads like Disney parks content.

reviews.review: I purchased this on my phone, thinking that my child, who is part of my iCloud Family, would be able to then install it for free on their phone. Turns out the app doesn’t support family sharing, despite that being super common on the App Store. Greedy. Now I’m stuck with an app on my phone I don’t want and we’ll have to pay for it again to put it on my kids phone. I guess we’ll just go with one of the free rip off versions instead of trying to support the original developer of the game.
reviews.potential_idea: Add family sharing support to the app, enabling iCloud Family members to access purchased apps without additional payments.

reviews.review: What happened to all the decks you can use for free? I just paid for the app to pay for decks??
reviews.potential_idea: Include a curated library of free, high-quality decks accessible to all paid app subscribers to provide immediate value and reduce perceived need for additional in-app purchases.

reviews.review:
Pay for the app only to get access to more game categories where you then have to PAY AGAIN to be able to even play. 
So when you pay for the app originally you literally get absolutely NO games to play.
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a one-time premium purchase option that unlocks full access to all game categories and unlimited gameplay without requiring additional in-app payments.

reviews.review: They removed the Make Your Own Deck feature and now this app is worthless. The decks I’ve bought replay the same 4 or 5 cards over and over again, making it unplayable.
reviews.potential_idea: Reintroduce an enhanced 'Make Your Own Deck' feature with AI-assisted randomization to ensure diverse card selections and prevent repetition in gameplay.

reviews.review: Get limited number of categories. Have to pay for more which is crazy for a paid app. Then the categories repeat themselves over and over. So you can’t play them multiple times
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce procedurally generated categories in the base paid app to provide unlimited variety without repetition or extra in-app purchases, enhancing replayability for users.

reviews.review: the app cost $1.99 which comes with limited amount of categories.  you have to buy everything else in app. i want a refund honestly this is a scam.
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a fully inclusive one-time purchase model for the app that unlocks all categories and features without any additional in-app purchases, providing transparent value from the outset.

reviews.review: Wants access to microphone and camera and also must pay to get additional decks.
reviews.potential_idea: Create a privacy-centric flashcard app offering unlimited free decks without mandating microphone or camera permissions, only requesting them for optional interactive features.

reviews.review: Got ride of the Bible deck our families favorite one to play
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a user restoration feature for removed card decks, allowing families to reinstate favorites like the Bible deck through a simple in-app request system.

reviews.review: Its fine. Kind of ridiculous to charge so much for other themes. Idk if others have issues but iv had issues with trying to start games or switching between the limited themes
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a bundle of free basic themes and implement a bug-free theme switching feature that prevents interruptions when starting games.

reviews.review: They don’t share that your purchase only includes 9 lackluster decks, with all other decks being for purchase starting at $12 each. There are plenty of free charades apps that offer the same thing with easier interfaces. The app also annoyingly replays memories from the home page, with no option I can find to mute them. To turn off the videoing feature I had to go my phone settings, because if there are settings within the app, they are ridiculously hard to find.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop an intuitive in-app settings menu that prominently allows users to disable video recording features and mute home page memory replays, addressing hidden options and improving overall user control.

reviews.review: Such a bad game. Lousy choices of subject, even after buying a ridiculously expensive add on pack. But even if you do what I did and get the packs, the clues/cards it gives you are horrible and super off topic like half the time. AVOID AVOID AVOID.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a trivia puzzle app with AI-powered clue generation that ensures 100% topic relevance by cross-referencing user-selected subjects in real-time.

reviews.review:
Heads up is fun but it needs some updates like only 60 seconds???
I think you should be able to get all the decks for free and just pay for the special decks and  needing to have voice and camera on for videos.
So if you really want to download it you should be a little bit careful
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a privacy mode for the Heads Up game that allows gameplay without requiring camera or microphone access, combined with free basic decks and paid premium ones.

reviews.review: User interface is terrible and the app keeps bricking all black. Requested refund immediately.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a crash recovery feature that automatically restarts the app from the last safe state and displays a user-friendly error notification instead of a black screen.

reviews.review: Tried everything even refunding and rebuying the bundle and for whatever reason it refuses to work. Outdated app with no way of customer support other than asking apple for a refund.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-app customer support system with live chat or ticketing to enable direct issue resolution for app functionality problems, reducing reliance on third-party refund processes.

reviews.review: Why must I pay for games when I just paid for the app.
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a premium app version with a one-time purchase that unlocks all in-app games without additional fees, addressing user frustration with surprise purchases.

reviews.review:
I bought this app, thinking it would come in handy, and would be a fun time I didn’t need to think much about. However, upon purchase, I found there were only like three free sets and they were all such bummy themes. All the interesting stuff is locked, and you have to pay more money to own them or sign up for a subscription. Of course, none of this is properly disclosed in advertising. Do not download!

“It is so bad i wanna give you a 0. But that's not possible so i give you a 1.”
reviews.potential_idea: A mobile app with transparent pre-purchase disclosure of free versus paid content, offering a substantial library of engaging free themes to allow users to fully evaluate the app before any additional monetization.

reviews.review: There should be an option to delete decks. Of all the decks that could be included for free, the content creators decide to put agenda decks in place to push sexuality agendas. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS.
reviews.potential_idea: Add a user-controlled feature to delete or hide unwanted decks, allowing customization and removal of content perceived as agenda-driven.

reviews.review: For sometime now, I will not get any pop-up notifications or text messages when my schedule has been posted, etc. I used to get them. I’ve checked all the settings. Everything is checked properly. I just don’t get notifications anymore.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a built-in notification diagnostic tool that tests and verifies alert delivery in real-time, addressing reliability issues for schedule updates.

reviews.review: It’s annoying how as an employee I have to pay for an app for my job
reviews.potential_idea: Create a corporate licensing platform where employers can purchase and distribute free app subscriptions to employees for work-related tools.

reviews.review:
I don’t know if it’s just me? But probably like 3 months (I’ve had it for 3 years now) after getting the app my push notifications for the app stopped working completely so I have to solely rely on my email every time I got notifications about work… yes I checked I have them on in my actual phone settings and my app settings I tried turning them off then on again still doesn’t work. Now a couple days ago my email notifications stopped working now too. 

Please fix this hot schedules starting to really get annoying
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-app notification diagnostic tool that automatically detects and troubleshoots push and email notification failures, guiding users to quick resolutions.

reviews.review: My notifications for this app are on but one day my coworkers and I stopped receiving notifications.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-app notification diagnostic tool that automatically detects and resolves delivery issues for users experiencing sudden notification failures.

reviews.review: An ok scheduling app. Major problem is that it redundantly adds appointments to your calendar, as many as 10 to 12 a day and requires lots of calendar maintenance to keep its entries correct.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a smart duplicate prevention feature that automatically detects and merges redundant calendar entries before adding new appointments.

reviews.review: I don’t know when this update was but i opened the app the hideous website style of hot schedules, just as glitchy too. the old version we had a few days ago was so much better </3
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a user toggle to switch between the new and legacy app interfaces, allowing users to revert to the smoother, preferred old design while fixing glitches in the update.

reviews.review:
0 out of 5 -As a business owner, I had high hopes for HotSchedules to streamline our employee scheduling, but it has been a complete letdown. The app’s communication features are abysmal, making it nearly impossible for my team to stay on the same page. It’s far from user-friendly—my employees found the interface confusing and frustrating to navigate, leading to constant issues with scheduling.

When we reached out to customer service and tech support for help, the experience was equally disappointing. The support team was unhelpful, and the issues persisted without resolution. After wasting time and energy, we switched to a much more user-friendly scheduling software that actually works for our team. I strongly recommend avoiding HotSchedules—it’s a headache not worth dealing with.
reviews.potential_idea: Create an AI-powered employee scheduling app with integrated real-time team chat and adaptive user interfaces that simplify navigation and auto-suggest resolutions for common scheduling conflicts, addressing communication and usability gaps in existing tools.

reviews.review:
I spent the whatever $2 to download this app, because it was apparently very important to do that in order for me to work.  Not an ideal, or really morally acceptable, time to hit somebody up for money, but that’s your decision.
From that point, I worked for two weeks and no one in management was authorized or able to finish my set-up process, citing a lack of customer support from the app.
I have since discovered that the job was not the best fit, and if I would have listened to my gut feeling I would’ve avoided that wasted time, but que será.  The simple fact is this app is a way for businesses to pass the buck onto their hourly wage earners, and I will use my last dying breath to urge people to avoid using it.
Power to the proletariat!
reviews.potential_idea: A free worker verification and job preview app that allows users to assess employer setup processes and support quality before paying for or committing to any work app.

reviews.review: have had this app for the last 3 yrs per company policy, not once has the app worked regularly. almost everyday in the morning both the paid app and website don’t even load past the login screen; sometimes not even that. what’s the point of making us pay for an app that doesn’t work and still charging the company to use it too.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an offline caching system for login sessions to allow users to access the app without server dependency during frequent morning loading failures.

reviews.review: I can’t login or even load anything it just spins for ever.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a login timeout feature with user-friendly error notifications to prevent infinite loading spinners and guide users on troubleshooting steps.

reviews.review: doesn’t work when I try to open the app
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an automatic app health check feature that detects and prompts fixes for launch failures before the main interface loads.

reviews.review: I paid for it n can’t use ur. I want a refund
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-app refund request feature for users unable to access paid content, streamlining support without external processes.

reviews.review: It charged me 7.99. like what?!
reviews.potential_idea: Add a mandatory preview screen showing the exact charge amount and details before confirming any in-app purchase to avoid surprise billing.

reviews.review: If I paid for this app, I think it should come with the option to ignore ads. I can't open my schedule without having to view company message every single time I get on the app and it's very frustrating
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce an ad-free mode for paid subscribers that allows users to bypass company messages and directly access their schedule without interruptions.

reviews.review: Everytime there is a company notification it’s continuously pops up every time you click on a different day or refresh that app. SO ANNOYING FIX IT
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a persistent notification dismissal feature that prevents company notifications from reappearing after the user has acknowledged them, even when navigating between days or refreshing the app.

reviews.review: First of all I had to purchase this app for $1.99, which is absurd because the app doesn’t even work half the time. It buffers at the loading screen. It seems they have tried to “update” this app so many times but, within the day they revert back to the original format. I despise this app and wish my job used a different platform.
reviews.potential_idea: Create a stable, free alternative mobile app for workplace tasks that prevents buffering issues and ensures permanent update implementations without reverting.

reviews.review: Its really really hard to believe how a schedule app that you pay for could be soo bad..but thats reality. A scheduling app that constantly has problems loading your schedule even if you are connected to wifi with no problems. The team at Hotschedules refuse to fix these problems that have plagued the app for years. They do not care about their customers or whether they have a functioning app.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a scheduling app with built-in offline caching and seamless syncing that ensures schedules load reliably even during connectivity issues, addressing chronic loading problems in existing apps.
